jobDescription: Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world’s most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Whether you are a software developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better. Summary The Account Representative serves as the primary contact between Ansys and customers in an assigned territory . The Account Representative is responsiblefor maintaining existing customer accounts while also working to create new. A successful Account Representative maximizes sales profitability, growth, and account penetration. Key Duties And Responsibilities Performs sales activities, establishes, develops and maintains business relationships with current and/or prospective customers to maintain renewal business and generate new business for an assigned geographic area, to achieve or exceed revenue objectives . Sells products/services through telephone as well as face-to-face contact . Uncover customer’s pain points, negative consequences, and desired positive business outcomes to identify the best solution. Clearly present the value of company’s products/services through metrics and proof points while tying to the customer’s needs and differentiating from competition . Creates and maintains account plans for existing customers highlighting profile, share and value opportunities . Research sources for developing prospective customers or expanding to new groups in existing customers and for information to determine their potential . Develops clear and effective written proposals/quotations for current and prospective customers . Coordinates sales effort with marketing, account team, sales management, accounting, legal and technical services groups. Provides accurate forecasts for new sales and renewal revenues . Participates in trade shows and conventions; schedules training and seminars to enhance new business opportunities . Required Skills And Experience Education & Years of Experience: Bachelor’s degree in technical, engineering, business or related field with 1+ years of experience of demonstrated success in technical sales positions OR 5+ years of experience demonstrated success in technical sales positions. Demonstrated understanding of engineering analysis and technology . Excellent communication and organizational skills and the ability to work independently . Travel: up to 50% Preferred Qualifications And Skills Fluent in English and in the local language of the territory Demonstrated knowledge of company's products/services and pricing practices . Knowledge of the specific territory, product line, or customer(s). ALIGNING YOUR VALUES TO OUR SOLUTIONS Our ONE Ansys Culture Has At Its Core At Ansys, our diverse, collaborative teams give us the strength and insight to solve the world’s most challenging engineering problems. Customer Focus Results and Accountability Innovation Transparency and Integrity Mastery Inclusiveness Sense of Urgency Collaboration and Teamwork ENGINEERING YOUR CAREER AT ANSYS At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary leaders across the globe. Collectively we strive to change the world with innovative technology and transformational solutions. With a prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high – met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. At Ansys, it’s about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It’s about the “what’s next” as much as the “mission accomplished.” And it’s about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and do impact real people in real ways. All this is forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics. At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel. Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology, empowering our customers to turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines. Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a member of the NASDAQ-100. We are proud to have been recognized for the following awards: Bay Area Best Places to Work, a Pillar World Awards Gold Winner, Fast Company Best Places to Work for Innovators, a Gold Stevie Award for Great Employers, the FORTUNE Future 50, a DCA Silver Winner, an R&D100 Finalist, a 20% by 2020 Women on Boards winner, a 2020 Pittsburgh Tech 50 – finalist, and America’s Most Responsible Companies. For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com We are committed to creating a culture of inclusion and belonging where everyone thrives as ONE Ansys team. Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world’s most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Whether you are a software developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better. Summary / Role Purpose The Accountant IIis a regional position that reports to the Manager, Revenue Recognition, based in Canonsburg, PA. This position is responsible for the calculation and reporting of royalties, participates in finance automation initiatives, and will work with internal and external stakeholders. Royalties include both revenue and expense from/to OEM partners that license Ansys software or license their software to Ansys, respectively. Royalties can be based on flat fee, per seat, revenue, or another type. Calculations are handled by an Alteryx workflow built to capture the various types. Alteryx is an exciting application that automates repetitive tasks through use of a custom workflow. Additional activities may include, but are not limited to, split/revenue distribution for Channel Partners and tracking consulting projects for revenue recognition and invoicing. Key Duties And Responsibilities Train to obtain Alteryx core certification within the first three months and Alteryx advanced certification within the first two years. Maintain advanced certification through bi-annual renewals. Using Alteryx, ensure all partner royalties are timely and accurately accrued and paid. Coordinate with various stakeholders to automate finance processes to improve speed, efficiency, and reporting ability. Create, edit and/or run Alteryx workflows. Perform monthly general ledger account reconciliations. Support the integration of newly acquired companies by assisting with transition to ANSYS policies and procedures. Support the department’s values and learning initiatives. Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience Ability to understand complex workflow processes. Interest in, and aptitude for, utilizing software tools to improve the accuracy, speed and/or value of report data. Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance or equivalent work experience. Strong follow-up skills with attention to detail and accuracy. Intermediate Excel skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Be that person that likes to go the extra mile, believes in teamwork and enjoys learning new skills. Preferred Qualifications And Skills Alteryx, Power BI, Oracle and NetSuite experience a plus. Advanced Excel skills. Experience working at a public, multinational technology company. Two or more years royalty accounting and/or finance automation experience, preferably with a technology company. ASC 606 revenue recognition experience. Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world’s most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Whether you are a software developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better. Summary / Role Purpose Join the Ansys Customer Excellence team to partner with our customers to engineer what's ahead, solve their real-world engineering problems, deploy Ansys software in their design workflows, and grow Ansys’ business. As a competent user of Ansys products, you will use engineering knowledge to provide technical pre-sales support, perform professional services, and help translate customer requirements into exciting new product features. A Corporate Application Engineer (CAE) becomes an expert in applying AGI's software for addressing some of the most challenging aerospace and defense problems. Based out of AGI Headquarters in Exton, PA, the CAE operates as part a dynamic team of engineers, software developers and business professionals who assist AGI customers in performing analyses, solving problems, and integrating and deploying custom software solutions. Currently, Ansys Government Initiatives (AGI) is searching for experienced candidates with a desire to make a meaningful contribution to the aerospace and defense community and who have the technical and interpersonal skills required to do so in our fast-paced work environment. Key Duties And Responsibilities Developing product expertise in the STK family of products Providing technical assistance, best-practice education and problem-solving support for a wide range of technically challenging aerospace and defense applications Working on-site with customers to implement software best practices and address real-world problems Presenting/documenting analysis results Programming user interfaces, automation scripts and integration code in support of customer applications Collaborate closely with other Ansys Customer Excellence teams and customers to integrate their multi-fidelity analytical models and/or tools in system-level and platform-based solutions Operate as part of a dynamic team of engineers, software developers and business professionals to assist customers in performing analyses, solving problems, and integrating and deploying custom solutions Collaborate with the Ansys product development teams to translate customer requirements into exciting new product features; test new releases of Ansys products on industrial problems Support Ansys field and digital marketing Contribute to consulting services, conduct introductory training classes Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience BS in an engineering or scientific discipline, preferably with knowledge of aerospace and aerospace sciences, MS preferred. 3+ years’ prior work experience in the aerospace industry is desirable Demonstrated ability in technical problem solving is mandatory Strong oral and written communication skills are required Demonstrated leadership skills Working knowledge or experience with STK and ODTK is desirable Scripting Experience in MATLAB, Python, or other scripting languages Programming experience in C, C++, C#, or Java Capable of self-management and responsibly executing multiple tasks in accordance with priorities and deadlines Strong organizational and time management skills, possesses a sense of urgency Projects a professional image and demonstrates business acumen, driven to succeed TS/SCI Clearances are highly desirable This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship. Preferred Qualifications And Skills Preferred education and years of professional experience in an engineering software environment: BS+ 2, or MS+0 Ability to travel domestically up to 50% of time ALIGNING YOUR VALUES TO OUR SOLUTIONS Our ONE Ansys Culture Has At Its Core At Ansys, our diverse, collaborative teams give us the strength and insight to solve the world’s most challenging engineering problems. Summary Based out of the Ansys Government Initiatives (AGI) office in Colorado Springs, CO or a home office in the Western United States, the Application Engineer (AE) is responsible for helping the AGI sales regions achieve their team goals. The AE operates as part a dynamic team of engineers, software developers and business professionals who assist customers in performing analyses, solving problems, and integrating and deploying custom software solutions. Currently, AGI is searching for experienced candidates with a desire to make a meaningful contribution to the Aerospace and Defense community and who have the technical and interpersonal skills required to do so in our fast-paced work environment. Develop and implement holistic system-level solutions by leveraging technologies and disciplines such as tool integration, model-based systems engineering, simulation process and data management, system-level solutions Operate as part of a dynamic team of engineers, software developers and business professionals to assist customers in performing analyses, solving problems, and integrating and Summary / Role Purpose Ansys is hiring a Program Manager to lead the development, implementation, and monitoring of Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEI&B) initiatives globally. The program manager will lead programs, trainings, and solutions that foster an open, equitable, and inclusive environment for all employees to thrive. This opportunity is for someone who thrives in an interesting and challenging work environment with a company that is making a major impact globally. The ideal candidate has strong program management experience and a passion for collaborating with smart people to shape a culture where all employees thrive and grow globally. This role will drive highly visible, impactful projects designed to increase diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging across Ansys globally. This position can sit remotely in the US or UK. Key Duties And Responsibilities As a member of the Talent Management team, build and manage innovative employee programs that foster an open, equitable, and inclusive environment in support of recruitment, retention, engagement, and development strategies. Lead full-cycle projects and strategic initiatives in support of our growing Employee Resource Group (ERG) community; drive ERG strategic plans, own ERG leader development, execute events, coordinate mentoring and development programs, support partnerships, and lead outreach efforts. Ensure ERGs impact business outcomes. Design innovative learning and development solutions for managers and employees that ensure people systems and processes are fair and unbiased. Provide expert input into the development of strategies and initiatives that address barriers to diversity; continuously assess opportunities to link DEIB work with ongoing business needs. Source DEIB training and development solutions and assess buy-versus-build strategies aligned to strategic plans and budgets. Be a DEIB champion, stay abreast of global trends and identify new opportunities to grow our body of work in areas of ESG, STEM and outreach. Manage participation in inclusion surveys and indexes that enhance our accountability and inform our action plans. Partner with talent acquisition and communication teams to tell our "story of inclusion” to employees, candidates, customers, and investors through contributions to annual publications, careers pages, our Corporate Responsibility Report, blogs, and social media. Establish program metrics, measures, and reporting to demonstrate programmatic success; maintain systems to track, measure and report on programs, identify risks and opportunities, and identify data-driven solutions. Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Behavioral Science, or related field with 5 + years of experience. 5 + years of program management experience preferably related to DEI&B work. Expert understanding of emerging topics around DEI&B within complex business settings. Strong project management experience with ability to drive multiple competing projects on time and on budget. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. Strong ability to collaborate and influence without authority. Excellent written, verbal, presentation, and interpersonal communication skills. Strong cross-cultural competence: ability to work inclusively with diverse teams globally. Deep technical knowledge including project management tools and platforms, SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and related technologies. Experience working with and influencing stakeholders, including senior leaders; able to productively interact with all levels on sensitive topics. Strong problem-solving skills. Experience translating data and analytics into actionable insights, telling stories and strong business cases that drive decisions and measurable impact. Great attention to detail with the ability to work under deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Brave, comfortable with ambiguity, open to driving change and strong willingness to learn from experience. Self-motivated and self-sufficient with demonstrated ability to function independently and as part of a team while managing multiple projects expertly in a fast-paced environment; can drive results with little day-to-day direct supervision. High EQ and interpersonal skills with experience developing relationships with peers and leaders across an organization. Exceptional project management and organizational skills. Preferred Qualifications And Skills HR, DEIB, and project management certifications a plus. Experience in a multi-national global organization. Working knowledge of applicable Federal, State and Local laws/regulations as relates to policies and procedures required to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical and professional behavior. Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world’s most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Whether you are a software developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better. Summary The Director Global Business Operations primary responsibility is to manage the global Business Operations team and ensure efficient cross functional support. They are responsible for influencing global departmental strategy, as well as managing the daily operations of the department by anticipating, guiding development of, and implementing required systems, procedures, and programs to consistently meet Ansys’ standards for quality, productivity and customer satisfaction. The Director Global Business Operations is also responsible for overseeing the global department budget, hiring, employee performance and pay reviews for all Business Operations members. Responsibilities Oversee daily operational activity of Business Operations staff globally including, but not limited to, order entry assistance, legal paperwork review and signature, policy and procedure adherence, and order preparation assistance Work collaboratively with Sales Operations and Product to define and execute a scalable repeatable global order and license fulfillment process maximizing the effectiveness of both our business processes and supporting systems Contribute as a business owner to the Company’s planned future CPQ evaluation and re-implementation, including allocation of dedicated resources from the business operations team Identify training needs within the team; coordinate and monitor cross- training efforts within the team to ensure members are knowledgeable in all technical areas Facilitate communication within the team and other functional groups regarding best practices and process improvements Represent business operations as part of the pricing committee, assessing implications of new products or new pricing approaches on order processing and ultimate fulfillment Represent business operations as part of the deal desk focused on optimizing deal creation and execution Lead integration efforts related to capturing the sales of acquired products into the Ansys financial system with the necessary SOX controls. In addition, drive in conjunction with Product, Sales and IT, their ultimate full transition into the core Ansys systems. jobTitle: Director, Go to Marketing Data Science and Strategy Analytics
jobDescription: Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Ansys is seeking to build our Data-Science and Analytics team with a brilliant and diverse leader that has an extensive background in data science, architecture, machine learning, and deep learning, while also bringing an intellectual curiosity on how to best incorporate and utilize analytics and insights from datasets across our Go-to-Market business The Director, Data-Science and Analytics is responsible for delivering data-driven decision making & self-serve analytics to optimize and support the GTM Strategy and Operations. The Data-Science and Analytics team builds and manages data platforms and dataflows, manages data and measurement governance, builds Machine Learning (ML) models, builds, and manages support-critical data tooling, and provides both core and business-specific analytics resources and guidance. Key Duties And Responsibilities Build end to end data science solutions/products and embed usage into the business Translate analytics insights into recommendations that are clearly linked to the organization's strategy and goals Identify and prioritize opportunities within the commercial business for Data Science to drive exponential value as well as ensure sharing and implementation of the best data science methodologies and processes across markets and functional areas Leading multiple high-impact, end-to-end data science projects Promoting the benefits, use cases, and impact of machine learning and AI both internally to senior leadership and externally to our clients Expanding and upskilling our data science team, including recruiting top talent, onboarding new team members, and advancing existing team members’ capabilities Utilizing your expertise in machine learning and AI to develop innovative use cases that support our GTM, marketing, and sales strategies Driving business development by serving as the data science expert on highly innovative and analytical project opportunities Swapping insights on the latest data trends in engaging team discussions Putting your attention to detail to good use by conducting research and observing changes in the advanced analytics market Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience Degree in Engineering, Statistics, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Computational Biology, Computational Chemistry, or related quantitative field with 10+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, analytics operations at scale, information technology, partner operations, finance, business planning, and/or equivalent experience OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field AND 8+ years’ experience in analytics operations, information technology 5+ years’ people management experience, including managing technology managers, vendors, and partners Industry certifications/certificates in data science, artificial intelligence, or machine learning Demonstrated team management, project management, leadership, and cross-group collaboration skills. Ability to create effective relationships, listen, influence, and collaborate internally and externally at all organizational levels. Ability to work through ambiguous situations with a can-do attitude and proactively determine creative solutions. As an expert communicator, you are able to simplify complex technical topics and convey them clearly to senior business executives Curiosity, openness to learning new technologies and strategies, and the ability to stay up to date with trends define your personality Experience with machine learning technology, such as: big data stack, Python, R, and visualization techniques In a programming language of your choice (e.g., Python, R), you can demonstrate your skills in modeling Your proficiency in selecting and applying AL and ML methods such as Random Forest, Neural Networks, Support Vector Machines, etc., sets you apart Preferred Qualifications And Skills Masters or Ph.D. preferred Demonstrated hypothesis-driven, problem-solving orientation with ability to leverage both quantitative and qualitative analyses to drive decision making. Strong oral and written communication skills and ability to formulate and deliver insights around complex business problems in a thoughtful and persuasive manner. Have a strong background in leading people with the ability to inspire confidence in senior leaders and motivate his/her global team. Exceptionally strong personal initiative, good business instincts, and comfort with ambiguity  Deep understanding of analytics and business technology markets, trends, and dynamics  Ability to manage multiple simultaneous high-priority projects (often including project management of cross-functional v-teams). Good written and verbal communication skills at all levels of the organization Domain expertise in Go-to-Market, Sales Strategy and/or Marketing An industry specialization in Software, High-Tech and/or B2B businesses Experience leading and/or managing global teams Large-scale deep learning model experience and training CULTURE AND VALUES Our Values Are Crucial For Fostering a Culture Of Winning For Our Company Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs – guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. The Enterprise Account Manager (“EAM”) is primarily responsible for meeting sales company growth targets and developing and executing upon a multi-year vision for executive level partnership engagement that generates substantial revenue growth potential. The Enterprise Accounts are the largest accounts at ANSYS with high expectations of sustainable customer engagement, collaboration, executive sponsorship, and growth. The successful EAM must understand customer environment, the customer’s customer/eco-system, customer’s business priorities, customer’s business challenges to align an ANSYS based solution that generates a measurable and impactful business outcome for the customer. The EAM must gain executive level sponsorship (with customer and inside of ANSYS), purchase commitment and manage the ongoing business relationship with the customer. Key Duties And Responsibilities Establishes a long-term account plan, with buy-in from senior levels of ANSYS organization. Define the long-term full potential of the account and ties this information into revenue expectations and resource planning. Knows the customer and its ecosystem. Develop in-depth knowledge of the customer and their industry. Understands customer’s internal relationships, including the biases and concerns of individual decision makers and key influencers. Establishes relationships with customer executives who can serve as business champions for ANSYS. Collaborates with account teams, product specialists, ACE, remote (direct/indirect) sites, business partners and other functions within ANSYS to ensure a synergistic, companywide approach to the account. Identifies customer’s problems, key business initiatives and creates ROI-based proposals aligned to initiatives and generating business outcomes for customer. Orchestrate seminars and training with presale engineers to strengthen our presence. Develops approach and business case (including required investments) to deliver sustainable growth. Creates roadmap to drive significant penetration across all applicable product lines. Monitors customer satisfaction and communicate customer concerns and issues along with EAM's expectations to the full account team, sales management, BUs and to others who serve the customer and communicate ANSYS commitment to the customer and manage customer expectations. Find and grow new opportunities as well as secure renewal sales. Facilitates comprehensive multiyear deal contract negotiations to achieve a win for both Ansys and the customer. Leads Customer Advisory Board process and executive sponsorship programs including Management Review Board (MRB) process. Remains knowledgeable and keeps abreast of ANSYS new and existing products/service pipeline to meet goals. Includes administrative work (quotation generation, order processing, delivery, acceptance inspection, NDA and other contract document preparation) Serve as a resource to Ansys channel partners within a designated territory by assisting with the sales process related to new and existing accounts, up to and including opportunity close. Minimum Education/Certification Requirements and Experience Education & Years of Experience: Bachelor’s degree in technical, engineering, business or related field with 4+ years of successful technical sales experience with a proven track record of success OR 8+ years of successful technical sales experience 2+ years’ experience as a senior/key/named account manager Demonstrated understanding of engineering analysis and technology. Excellent communication (including at executive level), organizational skills and the ability to work collaboratively. Demonstrated leadership and team-building skills required. Exceptional knowledge of competitors Fluent in English and in the local language of the territory Travel: up to 50% Preferred Qualifications and Skills Demonstrated knowledge of company's products/services and pricing practices Knowledge of the specific accounts ALIGNING YOUR VALUES TO OUR SOLUTIONS Our ONE Ansys Culture Has At Its Core At Ansys, our diverse, collaborative teams give us the strength and insight to solve the world’s most challenging engineering problems. Summary / Role Purpose The Ethics & Compliance Program Manager reports to the VP & Deputy General Counsel, Compliance and is responsible for implementing and maintaining different program elements needed to promote ethical practices at Ansys. In this role you will serve as a key member of the Ansys Ethics & Compliance Team and help build and maintain an effective ethics and compliance program that cultivates compliance with the Ansys Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, relevant laws and regulations, industry standards and Company policies. The role will be located at Ansys’ headquarters in Canonsburg, PA or remotely from any location within the continental United States. Key Duties And Responsibilities Provide compliance guidance across the Company and help to resolve compliance matters under minimal supervision Lead the compliance policies and procedures life cycle management efforts; draft and/or modify documents that ensure adherence to applicable laws and regulatory requirements and promote a culture of compliance Enable the review and update of ethics and compliance company policies, and manage the translation and localization of such policies Develop and maintain the compliance program training plan; develop training materials and deliver instructor led training to a diverse audience on company policies and compliance topics including anti-corruption, anti-fraud, conflicts of interest, data privacy, data protection, and third-party risks Create a scalable training and awareness campaign focused on enabling people leaders to support ethical decision-making and compliance at Ansys Plan and lead events around an annual “Ethics & Compliance Week” aimed at increasing employee awareness of the Ansys Code of Business Conduct and Ethics and other compliance-related topics Develop ethics and compliance content for internal and public-facing websites Assist in fostering a speak-up culture; manage the confidential hotline reporting system Compile, analyze, and track key metrics and prepare presentations for senior leadership and the Board of Directors Provide regular status updates to the VP & Deputy General Counsel, Compliance Support a variety of Ethics & Compliance Program activities, including response to internal and third-party program assessments, implementation of an employee sentiment and ethical culture survey, and generation of employee guidance for ethics and compliance policies Assist with the development, implementation and improvement of ethics and compliance policies, procedures, training and awareness that drive compliant behavior. Imagine and develop new programs as the Ansys Ethics & Compliance Program grows Assist with day-to-day administration of the Company’s corporate insurance program including claims administration and loss control activities, management of relationships with third party service providers including brokers and insurers, and updating and monitoring compliance with insurance procedures Assist with compilation of underwriting information and coverage placement Assist with other risk management projects and initiatives as required Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience Bachelor’s or advanced degree 8+ years of relevant corporate compliance and ethics experience or the functional equivalent, including experience in the following areas: ethics and compliance program development, training and communication expertise, policy development, project management, program analytics/metrics and brand development Strong understanding of what it means to be a compliance and ethics professional with a good sense for practical solutions High proficiency in Microsoft Office Proactive, flexible, responsive and resourceful Strict attention to detail Strong critical thinking skills and project management skills Excellent facilitation and presentation skills Experience working independently, with minimal supervision Ability to interact professionally with all organizational levels and proactively escalate issues to appropriate levels of management in the organization Represent leadership on projects within a specific area interfacing with project managers and cross-functional teams Strong communication skills (oral and written), with both legal and non-legal professionals and comfort working in a role requiring utmost discretion and confidentiality Ability to manage and prioritize multiple complex projects simultaneously Is flexible and adaptable - Summary And Role Purpose The Field Marketing Manager will develop, manage and evolve marketing programs for the ANSYS regional sales teams. This position works closely with key program stakeholders including product marketing managers, industry marketing managers, product managers, support teams and ANSYS regional sales teams. The primary objective of the role is demand generation through successful campaign execution and understanding of key industry trends, strategic market opportunities and sales priorities. Key Duties And Responsibilities Plans demand generation marketing programs to grow sales pipeline for the sales organization Executes strategic global marketing campaigns and industry campaign s Identifies new tactics to connect with market across all personas including users, managers and executives Builds a community of customers, prospects and students through PR, social media, webinars and other digital tactics Nurtures existing leads through digital content, events and other persona appropriate marketing methods. Monitor lead flow within the territory to ensure the appropriate sales channels are receiving and following up on leads Creates and manage territory program budget; measures ROI of field marketing tactics through metrics analysis and reporting. Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience Bachelor's degree required A minimum of 5 years of experience in B2B and/or Account-based marketing, specifically within the software or industrial equipment or ground transportation industry Proven ability to work closely and successfully with a sales organization Proven ability to successfully execute a variety of marketing programs, including targeted direct mail and email, field events, social media, executive engagements, awareness campaigns Experience with marketing automation systems to successfully run campaigns Ability to work very independently and collaborate with cross-functional teams Strong analytics, reporting, and written communication skills Rigorous attention to detail and focus on quality of deliverables Preferred Qualifications And Skills An MBA or other advanced degree is a plus. Experience in B2B and B2C demand generation environment preferred Ability to travel up to 25% Ability to earn trust through performance and relationship-building Prior experience working in a technical business setting with engineers or in engineering simulation is a plus ALIGNING YOUR VALUES TO OUR SOLUTIONS Our ONE Ansys Culture Has At Its Core At Ansys, our diverse, collaborative teams give us the strength and insight to solve the world’s most challenging engineering problems. Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Summary / Role Purpose Join the Ansys Student Internship Program to apply your education to solve real world engineering problems, advance career skills and experience work at Ansys. The student intern will be part of the Ansys Customer Excellence team focused on Optics. The intern will use the Ansys engineering simulation platform and products to create and apply Ansys simulation solutions in a variety of industries. The intern will get an opportunity to interact with Ansys global leaders. The internship will run from May 2023 through August 2023. Key Duties And Responsibilities Create new simulation methodologies, troubleshoot problem set-ups, run simulation benchmarks, and update industry best practices pertaining to modeling and simulation of engineered products & processes Update Ansys training course material Create technical marketing content Perform literature search to locate relevant publications using Ansys or competitive products, as well as experimental data Write detailed technical reports and present results to Ansys teams Network within the Ansys Customer Excellence team to learn various job functions such as presales support, post sales technical support, consulting services, etc. Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience Bachelor’s degree in Optical Engineering, Optical Sciences, Applied Physics or related field Currently enrolled as an engineering graduate student (M.S. or Ph.D.) in an accredited United States university. Ph.D. students should be entering third year or beyond of their program Minimum 3.0 GPA Authorized to work in the United States without requiring sponsorship by Ansys Ready to work at the advertised location without requiring relocation assistance by Ansys Motivated to learn. Strong problem solving, communication and time management skills Demonstrated skills in writing, understanding, and presenting in fluent English Demonstrated experience with optical modeling tools (e.g. Ansys Zemax OpticStudio, Ansys Speos, Synopsys CodeV, etc.) Experience with programming in Matlab, Python, C++, or C# Preferred Qualifications And Skills Knowledge of computer languages – C/C++, Python, Java Knowledge of CAD packages such as SolidWorks, NX, Catia Knowledge of Linux OS and general understanding of IT hardware and systems Experience in customer-facing and leadership roles. Proficient in developing learning plans and teaching in technical settings. Summer Co-op, Software Development - Undergraduate Location: Canonsburg, PA, US, 15317 Company: Ansys Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Summary ANSYS empowers the world's most innovative companies to design and deliver transformational products by offering the best and broadest engineering simulation software to solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Thus, through our enriching internship program, we help develop the next-generation of engineers and technologists. As a student co-op, you will help develop our industry-leading simulation software while gaining real experience in your field of study. You will work on a variety of impactful projects to help maintain, advance, and accelerate ANSYS products. In this position, you will support our geometry integration and CAD acquisition team. This is a 40-hour per week paid position starting May 2023 and ending in August 2023. Responsibilities Work alongside software developers during the design, implementation and verification process. Gain knowledge related to development tools and processes. Investigate defects in production code. Develop unit and regression tests. Analyze results and communicate findings with team members. Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to university after the completion of the internship program. Experience in object-oriented computer programming such as Java, C++, and C#. Preferred Qualifications High-school object-oriented computer programming experience. Summary The Lead cloud engineer is a hands-on role responsible for performance, availability, and scalability of the Businesses Public Cloud environment. This role will collaborate with Architects and other Engineers to enable enterprise applications to meet (or exceed) the organization business goals /OKR’s. This role will also be also involved in validating emerging technologies for cloud native workload to enable and support the businesses migratory journey to the Cloud. This role will also act as subject matter expert and mentor other team members as well as act in a consultative capacity with business unit specialists in relation to cloud. Responsibilities Managing Microsoft Azure systems; implementing best practices and industry standards. Migrating on-premises infrastructure to Microsoft Azure cloud. Working in an Azure based PaaS & SaaS services environment. Working directly with Azure Infrastructure as a Service (VM’s, vNet, Subnets, NSG’s, Resource Groups, etc.) deployment. Mentor other team members and act technical subject matter expert in relation to cloud to assist business units as required. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree Knowledge in Azure Active Directory, Roles and Policies Knowledge in Azure DNS. Knowledge in IT security Demonstrate strong ability to troubleshoot technical problems and issues Work closely with business unit teams on day-to-day tasks and incidents Knowledge in automation and scripting languages Understanding of Azure storage services Blob, File, Table and Queue Understanding of Azure HPC cluster UGE and Slurm. Experience working with Azure PaaS, Azure networking, and Azure site reliability solutions Strong practical knowledge of Windows and Linux server operating systems (on-premises & IaaS) Mentoring peers and Service Desk on reactive and proactive support tasks, policies and best practices Providing consultative services to business units as well as other teams within the IT organization 5 Years commercial experience in a similar role Preferred Qualifications Experience of AWS and Google Cloud useful ALIGNING YOUR VALUES TO OUR SOLUTIONS Our ONE Ansys Culture Has At Its Core At Ansys, our diverse, collaborative teams give us the strength and insight to solve the world’s most challenging engineering problems. Summary OnScale, an Ansys company, is leading a revolution in engineering simulation by moving complex multiphysics simulations to the cloud. Current OnScale solutions address the simulation needs of Semiconductor and MEMS, 5G mobile, next-gen biomedical, and autonomous vehicle markets. We’re hiring rockstars who are passionate about technology, love what they do, and who want to help build the Future of Engineering. The Lead Front End Developer leads the design and development of software products and supporting systems. In this role, the Lead Front End Developer will use expertise to develop strategic plans, refine requirements and provide technical leadership in achieving development objectives.  Responsibilities Leads planning, architecture, or research at a project level Coordinates product design and development activities requiring extensive analysis in areas such as user experience, software design and solver research. Summary The Manager FP&A will contribute to a team that leads all facets of financial planning, forecasting, reporting, and analysis. This person will need to have a strong big data skillset and experience with digital finance tools to build out reporting and analysis. Proficiency in EPM and Alteryx is preferred. The primary function of this role is to drive scalable standardized forecasting, reporting and insights across operating expense, ACV, revenue, and KPIs. Responsibilities Financial Management Design and implement a full end-to-end financial and operational reporting and forecasting processes. Manage the annual budget cycle and monthly/quarter forecasts. Drive improved reporting and insights; analyze financial results and communicate business insights to field and FP&A leadership. Partner with finance leaders, business leaders and other key stakeholders to drive insights, analytics and forward-looking actions. Define key performance indicators and profitability measures and build linkage to financial forecasts and actual performance. Reconcile and improve data quality. Document current reporting and practices, propose and implement enhancements. Implement improved financial reporting processes and drive streamlining and simplification. Ensure timely and accurate work product; meet or exceed established service levels. Leading, motivating and developing high potential talent to provide opportunities for career development and business exposure. Business Partnering Be a visible, collaborative, accessible contributor within the Finance organization. Document business needs and provide global, consistent coverage and support for the organization. Facilitate finance optimization efforts and help us build a world-class FP&A organization; develop, standardize, maintain, and drive continuous improvement of all planning and forecasting processes. Serve as the trusted advisor to FP&A leadership. Assess risks and opportunities versus annual company targets. Evaluate forecast outputs to optimize future results. Ensure financial results are standardized, impactful, and understandable for Sales, Finance, and general management audiences. Participate in appropriate training to enable the adoption of new processes, tools, and models. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, or a quantitative discipline. Advanced degree or professional qualification such as MBA, CFA is a plus. A minimum of 5 years of core FP&A experience – forecasting, planning, and business partnering. 1-2 years of people leadership preferred and a desire to build a new support function. Advanced proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, and other Office software. Proficiency with Alteryx and EPM. Demonstrated adoption of modern tools for business analytics, such as planning systems, data analysis, and visualization/dashboard tools. Experience in building and automating different types of financial models, reports, processes. Strong organization skills and attention to detail. Ability to prioritize competing projects/deliverables, meet deadlines, collaborate with other business functions, and work well independently. Demonstrated interpersonal, relational, analytical, problem-solving and communication skills, with poise to present at the senior-most levels in the business. History of self-motivated, independent decision-making, creativity, and thought leadership. Proven ability to direct cross-functional teams to complete strategic financial objectives. Demonstrated leadership qualities; ability to engage and influence team and external partners; technical acumen to interpret business implications. Summary / Role Purpose The Sales Development Representative plays a key role in creating and developing opportunities for new business by generating qualified leads for the Ansys, Inc. sales team. The Sales Development Representative is responsible to partner locally with field sales and channel team to nurture leads with the intent of delivering qualified opportunities to sales based on predetermined criteria. In addition to lead generation and development, the Sales Development Representative is responsible for engaging customers during Ansys event and tradeshows, updating the CRM databases with information gathered with every prospect contact. The successful Sales Development Representative generates Lead development through significant engagement in a business-to-business environment and use of internet/internal database resources to identify and profile new customers. The Sales Development Representative is an active team player, fostering sales and marketing collaboration and alignment towards joint goals. Key Duties And Responsibilities Accountable to support the lead qualification, routing and administration process (where applicable) at Ansys. Generating new business and interest through account-based marketing programs, involving email and calling campaigns Follow up on prospect inquiries relating to Ansys software products, qualify them by applying sales and technical expertise and pass them to the appropriate opportunity owner and help to schedule meetings, appointments, and demos where needed . Effectively partner and work across the Marketing, Sales, Channel and Product teams to support achievement of Sales target. Research, identify and create new market opportunities through targeted engagement into prospect accounts. Work closely with key internal teams and engage current accounts to develop account intelligence, relationship maps, and use case opportunities through direct account engagement and insight tools to expand awareness, education, referral networks. Collaborate with marketing teams on the marketing plans & campaigns (marketing material, seminar, webinar, Ansys events, tradeshows and digitally led customer engagement programs, etc) and ensure traffic at these events . Ensure the data integrity & consistency in CRM by updating the lead and/or contact info and account/prospect intelligence gathered to provide visibility to market opportunities in assigned territory . Contribute to efficient and useful reporting of different lead aspects per territory . Develop and communicate ongoing improvements to the process of prospecting for and qualifying leads . Work on special territory-specific projects and team-specific responsibilities as directed. Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience Education & Years of Experience: Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, engineering or related field with 0+ years’ experience in an inside sales function, sales or presales environment of complex technical / industrial products OR 4+ years’ experience in an inside sales function, sales or presales environment of complex technical / industrial products Technical aptitude and/or 1 year of experience in an industrial/technical sales environment Excellent record of customer service and customer satisfaction Experience in leveraging social media to identify and engage with key decision makers . Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world’s most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Whether you are a software developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better. Summary ANSYS, Inc. seeks Principal Application Engineer SCBU to work in San Jose, CA. Responsibilities Lead the evaluation, deployment, and support of innovative solutions for software products and supporting systems. Act as a technical reference, working closely with customers, partners, R&D Engineers, and Sales teams to evaluate and deploy major new flows, methods and capabilities to meet business objectives. Serve as a regional subject matter expert in multiple tools. Lead technical campaigns and direct peers to successful completion. Own a complete solution (i.e. tool/command, documentation, etc.) and drive it to closure. Develop and deliver training and education to peers and customers. Serve as a mentor for junior level application engineers. Negotiate success criteria with customers for critical technical campaigns. Discover and contribute to closing new business opportunities. Become a trusted advisor to customers. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Electrical, Electronic or Computer Engineering or a related field of study, and twelve (12) years of experience in a related position. Alternate Acceptable Education and Work Experience Requirement: Master’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Electrical, Electronic or Computer Engineering or a related field of study, and ten (10) years of experience in a related position. Work experience or academic coursework must have included: circuit analysis and design, physical design, timing and noise analysis, or voltage drop related analysis with EDA/CAD tools; technical knowledge of EDA tools on layout, STA, Extraction-SPEF/DSPF and Spice; demonstrated domain expertise in on-chip and system level power noise and reliability; experience providing technical presentations to customers; experience crafting robust and efficient scripts; and TCL and Python programming. Domestic and international travel required up to 10% of time. Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Summary The Principal Astrodynamics Engineer leads the design and development of innovative aerospace software solutions and serves as a critical astrodynamics subject matter expert for the organization. In this role, the Principal Astrodynamics Engineer will act as a technical reference, working closely with customers, partners, application engineers and development teams to define and deploy major new capabilities and algorithms. Key Duties & Responsibilities Conducts extensive astrodynamics domain analysis in support of software development efforts across multiple products and capabilities. Acts as a technical reference across groups or products. Works directly within the software to investigate and improve software capabilities. Works with strategic customers or proxies to assess needs and develop solutions. Defines, develops, and employs best practices and maintains them through technical reviews and mentoring. Researches and understands the marketing requirements for products, including target environment, performance criteria and competitive issues. Operates without direct supervision and functions as a high-level organizational leader. May be responsible for line management of a small technical team, but primary duties are of an individual technical nature. This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship. Minimum Education & Experience MS in Aerospace (Astro) Engineering or related field, plus 10 years’ aerospace domain experience, or a PhD and 8 years of relevant academic or industry experience Familiarity with software development and coding practices Ability to develop expertise in commercial aerospace software development Demonstrated leadership with a track record of delivering state-of-the-art results on complex problems Preferred Qualifications & Skills Fluency with software development and coding practices, in particular C++, C#, etc. Expert-level knowledge in one or more of the following domain areas: Low-thrust trajectory optimization General trajectory optimization Optimal control Attitude control & determination Orbit determination Strong mathematical background, including partial derivatives, coordinate systems, transformations, and estimation theory (batch least squares and extended Kalman filters). Operational experience in orbit determination and/or spacecraft trajectory design. Proven research skills within the astrodynamics community Proven ability to understand customer and/or business requirements and translate them into software plans and capabilities Ability to convey complex information in a clear way to stakeholders and development teams Ability to drive success across teams and geographies, and to mentor others CULTURE AND VALUES Our Values Are Crucial For Fostering a Culture Of Winning For Our Company Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs – guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Summary The Cloud Product Sales Manager is responsible for directing and supporting collaborative sales efforts to grow Ansys Cloud product lines. The successful Cloud Product Sales Manager will ensure the profitability and continued growth of Ansys Cloud products for the organization. As an expert in the assigned product line, the Cloud Product Sales Manager is responsible for achieving a direct sales quota in that product line, as well as supporting overall product-line success, all within an overlay structure. Key Duties And Responsibilities Work with direct account teams to assist and encourage their customers in evaluating and adopting cloud products for Ansys workflows. Performs product sales activities for new/renewal business for one or more assigned product lines to achieve or exceed assigned product and service revenue objectives. Partners with field and enterprise sales within Ansys and Channel partners, to collaboratively develop and pro-actively execute strategies that drive product and service revenue as part of an overall account strategy. Effectively contributes to all stages of the sales process. Facilitates communication with the sales and technical team with respect to updates on product capabilities, success stories and winning strategies. Establishes, develops and maintains business relationships with current and prospective customers to generate new business for the organization’s products and services. Participates in industry shows and conventions. Creates and leads advanced solution presentations to match identified customer needs using company's products & services. Identifies Ansys advantages and positions Ansys’ products and services as superior to competitive offerings. Coordinates and organizes technical (ACE) support for demos, PoCs, support of evaluation, training etc. Works with team members to develop clear and effective written proposals, quotations, and value propositions for current and prospective customers. Provides client feedback to product development and marketing staff. Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience Education & Years of Experience: Bachelor’s degree in technical, engineering, business or related field with 4+ years sales or consulting experience in selling engineering/technology applications with a proven track record of success OR 8+ years sales or consulting experience in selling engineering/technology applications with a proven track record of success OR 6+ years' experience of running and leading HPC and/or cloud engineering solutions at an end-user organization. Demonstrated proficiency of engineering analysis and technology with a particular focus on High Performance Computing (HPC) for CAE workflows.. Have a basic understanding of the needs for both IT and CAE end users with relation to HPC workflows. Excellent communication and organizational skills and the ability to work independently, interdisciplinary and with several teams (ACE, DEV, Marketing, PM etc.) and hierarchies within the organization. Ability to foster collaboration & coordination with personal distributed across multiple global sites Fluent in English and in the local language of the territory Travel: up to 50% Preferred Qualifications And Skills Demonstrated knowledge of company's products/services and pricing practices a plus. Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of the product market position. Experience using or maintaining HPC systems Experience running CAD/CAE applications in the cloud Experience integrating on-premise HPC workflows into the cloud Technical cloud accreditations (e.g. AWS Certified Solutions Architect) Aptitude for problem-solving; ability to determine appropriate solutions for customers. Ability to network using direct (face to face) or indirect (email, phone, social media) technology. Summary ANSYS Mechanical is used by engineers to analyze the structural and thermal physical responses for different environmental conditions. The R&D Engineer will be joining a team which is responsible for developing, maintaining, and improving features that support customization, data management and services within ANSYS Mechanical with usability and performance at the forefront. Responsibilities The incumbent will be following agile principles to define, implement, test and document features within the ANSYS Mechanical product with other team members. Also, to ensure the quality of the product the incumbent will triage and correct defects. Some specific responsibilities will be: Develop new and expand on existing features in a mixed code base of C++, C# and Python which will be functional on Windows and Linux platforms Write unit tests and work with testing staff to define integration tests Build an understanding of the code architecture to participate in the maintenance, improvement, and support of the Mechanical product Expand knowledge and use of software technologies to deliver best of class software Communicate with geographically distributed team members Minimum Qualifications The candidate will be able to demonstrate that they meet these minimal qualifications: B.S. degree in Computer Science/ Engineering, Mechanical/Civil/Aeronautical Engineering, or equivalent field of study Experience in designing and implementing object-oriented application features using C++ or C# Experience with Python Preferred Qualifications It is advantageous that the candidate has experience with the following: A passion to create high quality software; a desire to solve complex problems; able to learn quickly while collaborating with a distributed team Meeting timelines with minimal supervision Microsoft Technologies (.NET Framework, COM, ATL) Behavior Driven-Development or similar techniques Microsoft Visual Studio IDE for managing code projects Git version control Clear written and oral communication skills FEA or similar computational techniques ALIGNING YOUR VALUES TO OUR SOLUTIONS Our ONE Ansys Culture Has At Its Core At Ansys, our diverse, collaborative teams give us the strength and insight to solve the world’s most challenging engineering problems. Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world’s most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Whether you are a software developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better. Summary The R&D Engineer contributes to the development of software products and supporting systems. In this role, the R&D Engineer will collaborate with a team of expert professionals to accomplish development objectives.   This engineer will join the Redhawk-SC Research and Development team that creates state of the art software for semiconductor analysis. RedHawk-SC is the proven industry leader for power noise and reliability signoff for SoC designs. RedHawk-SC enables creation of high-performance SoCs that are still power efficient and reliable against thermal, electromigration (EM) and electrostatic discharge (ESD) issues for markets such as mobile, communications, high-performance computing, automotive and internet of things (IoT). RedHawk-SC is a next-generation solution built on Ansys SeaScape, the world's first custom-designed, big data architecture for electronic system design and simulation. SeaScape provides per-core scalability, flexible design data access, instantaneous design bring-up, MapReduce-enabled analytics and many other revolutionary capabilities. Responsibilities Performs basic development activities, including the design, implementation, maintenance, testing and documentation of software modules and sub-systems. Learns and employs best practices. Performs basic bug verification, release testing and beta support for assigned products. Research problems discovered by QA or product support and develops solutions. Works under the close supervision of a development manager Minimum Qualifications BS in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field Experience with C or C++ with broad and deep understanding of the language Preferred Qualifications Technical knowledge and experience with object-oriented design, data structures, algorithms, linear algebra and high-performance computing Basic understanding of the software development process Good communication and interpersonal skills Ability to learn quickly and to collaborate with others in a geographically distributed team. Experience in optimizing large scale software for memory and run time. Experience in solving large scale linear system of equations using numerical methods. Development, debugging and optimization of systems using distributed processing. Experience with the Python programming language Power delivery network simulation for advanced semiconductor nodes Time-domain based large scale circuit simulation techniques. Summary The R&D Engineer II contributes to the development of software products and supporting systems. In this role, the R&D Engineer II will collaborate with a team of expert professionals to understand customer requirements and accomplish development objectives. The successful candidate will design and develop frameworks and APIs that simplify the licensing of our products and support new business models. Responsibilities Performs moderately complex development activities, including the design, implementation, maintenance, testing and documentation of software modules and sub-systems. Understands and employs best practices. Performs moderately complex bug verification, release testing and beta support for assigned products. Research problems discovered by QA or product support and develops solutions. Understands the marketing requirements for a product, including target environment, performance criteria and competitive issues. Works under the general supervision of a development manager. Participates in planning, architecture, and research. Minimum Qualifications BS in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field with 2 years’ experience or MS. Work experience with C/C++ and REST API. Prior experience developing with web/cloud-based technologies. Preferred Qualifications Technical knowledge and experience with C/C++ or Java/J2EE. Experience in a large-scale commercial software development environment. Experience in architecting, designing, and developing enterprise applications using Service Oriented Architecture with SOAP/REST and microservices. Experience with client server architecture. Experience with licensing technologies like FlexNet Embedded, FlexNet Operations, or Sentinel RMS. Network protocol and computer system knowledge. Passion for crafting robust and efficient code. Understanding of customer requirements and tools used in this domain. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to learn quickly and to collaborate with others in a geographically distributed team ALIGNING YOUR VALUES TO OUR SOLUTIONS Our ONE Ansys Culture Has At Its Core At Ansys, our diverse, collaborative teams give us the strength and insight to solve the world’s most challenging engineering problems. Work experience or academic coursework must have included: C/C++ and STL; Windows and Linux; and experience in the full software development process, including unit/integration testing. Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world’s most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Whether you are a software developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better. Summary The meshing development unit (MDU) is seeking an experienced R&D engineer II to develop next-generation meshing architecture & infrastructure. A successful candidate will be part of a team that is responsible for the research, design, and implementation of meshing and other pre-processing technologies. This role requires an analytical and curious mind with a strong interest in software architecture, mesh generation, computational geometry, and numerical methods. The focus will be on architecting next-generation meshing data structure and algorithm development. Knowledge of data structure, and computational geometry algorithms is advantageous. The background and experience in combination with the interest of the successful applicant will be considered for the work assignment. This developer can expect to be engaged in all stages of code and capability planning, research, creation, and evolution, and to work closely with other members of the meshing software development team. Responsibilities Design, create, review, maintain and extend meshing data structure and architecture. Develop, maintain, and extend next-generation meshing infrastructure. Work efficiently in a complex mixed language code base, written in Python, C/C++, on Windows and Linux. Employ best practices and helps to maintain them through technical reviews and mentoring. Improve speed and memory performance of the software for generating large-scale meshes on complex real-world geometries. Work independently with minimal supervision and may take on some mentoring responsibilities. Participate in and collaborate with other development, documentation, and testing professionals in all phases of the software development life cycle. Coordinate with and assist other product creation teams and customer support representatives involved in meshing large, complex geometries. Minimum Qualifications BS in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, or Applied Mathematics with 2 years experience or MS Commercial software development experience. Strong analytical skills. Mesh generation, computational geometry, and/or computer graphics algorithm development experience. Strong knowledge of C++ programming skills with good knowledge of STL containers and data structures. Preferred Qualifications Ph.D. in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, or Applied Mathematics. Passion for crafting robust and efficient code Keen interest in programming and algorithm development. Experience in GPU- threaded- or distributed parallel programming is an asset. Experience in workflow automation, e.g. from meshing, geometry processing, or computer games. Ability to function in a team environment. Self-motivating, taking the initiative to resolve issues and working with a sense of urgency. Good communication and interpersonal skills ALIGNING YOUR VALUES TO OUR SOLUTIONS Our ONE Ansys Culture Has At Its Core At Ansys, our diverse, collaborative teams give us the strength and insight to solve the world’s most challenging engineering problems. Whether you are a software developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better. Summary The R&D Engineer II contributes to the development of software products and supporting systems. As part of Office of CTO, in this role you will do machine learning and deep learning to design and implement scalable ML systems for ANSYS product portfolios. Responsibilities Performs complex development activities, including the research, design, development, maintenance, testing and documentation of machine learning models as applied to numerical simulations. Research deep learning methods to apply them for numerical simulation in context of fluids, structures, electromagnetics, optics, and electronics. Participates in brainstorming, planning, architecture and research. Collaborate with product engineering teams to drive real-time model implementations and new feature creations. Maintains efficient/scalable processes for large scale data analyses, model development, framework development, model validation and model implementation. Diagnose and fix code problems. Create unit regression and/or system-level tests to thoroughly validate new features or changes. Works under the general supervision of a development manager Minimum Qualifications BS in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. Working experience developing machine learning code in C++ or Python with a focus on deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX, or Scikit Learn Preferred Qualifications Masters or a PhD degree with 1 yrs experience in computer graphics, computer vision, physics or applied mathematics or engineering   Experience with GPU programming (CUDA, OpenGL, OpenCL, DirectX).  Publication in leading journals or conferences such as SIGGRAPH, CVPR, NeurlPS or ICLR Experience with 3D geometry, computer graphics or computer vision ALIGNING YOUR VALUES TO OUR SOLUTIONS Our ONE Ansys Culture Has At Its Core At Ansys, our diverse, collaborative teams give us the strength and insight to solve the world’s most challenging engineering problems.
