Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world’s most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Whether you are a software developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better. Summary The meshing development unit (MDU) is seeking an experienced R&D engineer to develop start-of-the-art mesh generation software. A successful candidate will be part of a team that is focused on the research, design, and implementation of meshing technologies. The focus of this role will be on unstructured quadrilateral mesh generation. Strong analytical abilities and independent problem-solving skills are needed. Knowledge of data structure and computational geometry is advantageous. This developer can expect to be engaged in all stages of code and capability planning, research, creation, and evolution, and to work closely with other members of the meshing software development team. Responsibilities Design, create, review, maintain and extend meshing code. Work efficiently in a complex mixed language code base, written in Python, C/C++, on Windows and Linux. Employ best practices and help to maintain them through technical reviews and mentoring. Innovate new meshing algorithms and improve the existing techniques for generating high-quality quadrilateral meshes on complex real-world geometries. Work with minimal supervision and may take on some mentoring responsibilities. Participate in and collaborate with other development, documentation, and testing professionals in all phases of the software development life cycle. Minimum Qualifications BS in Engineering, Computer Science, or Applied Mathematics with 2 years’ experience or MS. Sound knowledge of unstructured quadrilateral mesh generation/optimization methods. Strong analytical abilities and independent problem-solving skills. Strong C/C++ programming skills. Preferred Qualifications Ph.D. in Engineering, Computer Science, or Applied Mathematics. Knowledge of unstructured surface/volume mesh generation algorithms. Knowledge of data structure and computational geometry. Experience in Java/Python, Visual Studio and Git. Strong interest in programming and algorithm development. Passion for crafting robust and efficient code. Ability to function in a team environment. Self-motivating, taking the initiative to resolve issues and working with a sense of urgency. Good communication and interpersonal skills. jobTitle: R&D Engineer II - Software Development - Remote
jobDescription: Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world’s most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Summary The R&D Engineer II contributes to the development of software products and supporting systems. In this role, the R&D Engineer II will collaborate with a team of expert professionals to understand customer requirements and accomplish development objectives. Ansys RedHawk-SC Electrothermal offer a multiphysics solution and is the proven industry leader for analyzing 3DIC and multi-die chip packages and interconnects for power integrity, parasitic extraction, thermal behavior, and thermo-mechanical stress. It works together with the RedHawk-SC power integrity platform and is foundry certified for integrated fanout and silicon interposer technologies. RedHawk-SC Electrothermal enables creation of high-performance SoCs that are power efficient and reliable against thermal, electromigration (EM) and electrostatic discharge (ESD) issues for markets such as mobile, communications, high-performance computing, automotive and internet of things (IoT). RedHawk-SC Electrothermal meets the challenges of today’s complex 2.5D/3D IC packages with a comprehensive multiphysics approach that unifies electrical and thermal analysis at the chip, board and system levels. Responsibilities Performs moderately complex development activities, including the design, implementation, maintenance, testing and documentation of software modules and sub-systems Understands and employs best practices Performs moderately complex bug verification, release testing and beta support for assigned products. Researches problems discovered by QA or product support and develops solutions Understands the marketing requirements for a product, including target environment, performance criteria and competitive issues Works under the general supervision of a development manager Minimum Qualifications BS in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field with 2 years’ experience or MS Working experience with C or C++ with broad and deep understanding of the language. Preferred Qualifications Technical knowledge and experience with object-oriented design, data structures, algorithms, linear algebra and high-performance computing Experience in a large-scale commercial software development environment Good communication and interpersonal skills Ability to learn quickly and to collaborate with others in a geographically distributed team Experience in optimizing large scale software for memory and run time.. Development, debugging and optimization of systems using distributed processing. Experience with the Tcl or Python programming language Knowledge of Power and Thermal integrity concepts and analysis methods ALIGNING YOUR VALUES TO OUR SOLUTIONS Our ONE Ansys Culture Has At Its Core At Ansys, our diverse, collaborative teams give us the strength and insight to solve the world’s most challenging engineering problems. The RSM directs the work effort of field sales, and sales support . This role develops long term strategies and sets the agenda around the right priorities of the team to win at the customer. A successful Regional Sales Manager empowers their team to be responsible for their work and inspires others to reach for excellence. Key Duties And Responsibilities Oversees an assigned geographic area, set of accounts or product/service line to maximize sales revenues and meet corporate objectives. Accurately forecasts annual, quarterly, and monthly revenue streams . Develops long term account strategies for larger accounts and specific plans to ensure revenue growth in all company's products/services . Coordinates appropriate company resources to ensure efficient and consistent sales . Conducts long-range studies of changes in sales and strategies . Recruits, directs, coaches, develops, rewards, motivates, and assesses field sales team members. Educates field sales in terms of sales techniques and tactics . Establishes and manages effective programs and seminars to address the following issues: New account sales and field sales growth Growth in existing ELA customers Enhancement of field sales and inside sales revenues Sales of emerging products/services Pro-active competitive strategies and targeted sales campaigns Proper use and level of sales support Business/financial issues on contracts Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience Education & Years of Experience: Bachelor’s degree in technical, engineering, business or related field with 8+ years of experience of demonstrated success in technical sales positions OR 12+ years of experience demonstrated success in technical sales positions. Strong leadership capabilities and ability to motivate and inspire a team . Ability to forecast, estimate revenue and profit trends . Strong understanding of industry cycles and regulations Travel: up to 50% Preferred Qualifications And Skills Master’s degree or MBA Management experience High level of knowledge of company's products/services, pricing practices, and selling skills. The Sales Development Intern plays a key role in creating and developing opportunities for new business by generating leads for the Ansys, Inc. sales team.  In this internship you will partner locally with the sales development team to prospect leads with the intent of delivering qualified opportunities to sales based on predetermined criteria.    The experience you will gain through this internship is significant engagement in a business-to-business environment and use of internet/internal database resources to identify and profile new customers.     This is a 40-hour per week paid position starting in May 2023 and ends in August 2023.  Key Duties and Responsibilities  · Support the lead prospecting, routing and administration process at Ansys. ​  · Generating new business and interest through account-based prospecting programs, involving email and calling campaigns  · Follow up on prospect inquiries relating to Ansys software products, qualify them by applying sales and technical expertise and pass them to the appropriate opportunity owner and help to schedule meetings, appointments, and demos where needed​.  · Effectively partner and work across the Marketing, Sales, Channel and Product teams to support achievement of Sales target.​  · Research, identify and create new market opportunities through targeted engagement into prospect accounts.  · Work closely with key internal teams and engage current accounts to develop account intelligence, relationship maps, and use case opportunities through direct account engagement and insight tools to expand awareness, education, referral networks.​  · Ensure the data integrity & consistency in CRM by updating the lead and/or contact info and account/prospect intelligence gathered to provide visibility to market opportunities in assigned territory​.    Minimum Education/Certification Requirements and Experience  · Pursuing a bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering or similar discipline.   · Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to university after the completion of the internship program.  · A drive to win and continuous learner.   · A great networker, who can build trust and meaningful connections.  · A great communicator.  · Technical aptitude   · Experience in leveraging social media     Preferred Qualifications and Skills  · Able to assess business opportunities based on predetermined criteria in order to align opportunities with sales​  · Able to understand industry issues and apply software value statements in order to engage with prospective customers in a meaningful and mutually beneficial manner​  · Ability to engage with prospective customers based on open probes and creation of value statements​.

Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. The Sales Development Intern plays a key role in creating and developing opportunities for new business by generating leads for the Ansys, Inc. sales team. In this internship you will partner locally with the sales development team to prospect leads with the intent of delivering qualified opportunities to sales based on predetermined criteria. The experience you will gain through this internship is significant engagement in a business-to-business environment and use of internet/internal database resources to identify and profile new customers. This is a 40-hour per week paid position starting in May 2023 and ends in August 2023. What You Will Receive An opportunity to join a fast-growing Company that lives on the edge of brilliant physics and revolutionary ideas to push the limits of what’s next. Learn the aspects of what it takes to build a career in software Sales and Marketing Be introduced to and gain experience in Salesforce CRM, High Velocity Sales - Sales Enablement Platform. A seat at the table to share your ideas and make your voice heard An opportunity to be part of the team throughout the school year and/or full-time after graduation School/College credit (if applicable) Personal and professional development Key Duties and Responsibilities Support the lead prospecting, routing and administration process at Ansys.  Generating new business and interest through account-based prospecting programs, involving email and calling campaigns Follow up on prospect inquiries relating to Ansys software products, qualify them by applying sales and technical expertise and pass them to the appropriate opportunity owner and help to schedule meetings, appointments, and demos where needed . Effectively partner and work across the Marketing, Sales, Channel and Product teams to support achievement of Sales target. Research, identify and create new market opportunities through targeted engagement into prospect accounts. Work closely with key internal teams and engage current accounts to develop account intelligence, relationship maps, and use case opportunities through direct account engagement and insight tools to expand awareness, education, referral networks. Ensure the data integrity & consistency in CRM by updating the lead and/or contact info and account/prospect intelligence gathered to provide visibility to market opportunities in assigned territory . Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience Pursuing a bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering or similar discipline. Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to university after the completion of the internship program.  A drive to win and continuous learner. A great networker, who can build trust and meaningful connections. A great communicator. Technical aptitude Experience in leveraging social media Preferred Qualifications And Skills Able to assess business opportunities based on predetermined criteria in order to align opportunities with sales Able to understand industry issues and apply software value statements in order to engage with prospective customers in a meaningful and mutually beneficial manner Ability to engage with prospective customers based on open probes and creation of value statements . Summary ANSYS, Inc. seeks Senior Accountant to work in Canonsburg, PA. Responsibilities The primary function of this position is to act as a liaison between the Company’s U.S. headquarters and its foreign subsidiaries. The objective of the position will be to ensure that the financial results of the aforementioned subsidiaries are properly reported based on U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), as well as to provide the subsidiaries with financial and operational support, as required. Ensure accounting for assigned subsidiaries is in accordance with US GAAP. This includes a periodic review of reconciliations for all balance sheet accounts and analysis of balance sheet and income statement fluctuations. Ensure proper and timely recording of intercompany charges and payments. Prepare and/or review assigned subsidiary cash flow statements. Present accounting policy topics / updates to the Finance management team and foreign controller group. Assist with corporate accounting tasks and special projects as needed. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance or a related field of study, and Five (5) years of experience in a related financial accounting or auditing position. Alternate Acceptable Education and Work Experience Requirement: Master’s degree or foreign equivalent in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance or a related field of study, and three (3) years of experience in a related financial accounting or auditing position Work experience or academic coursework must have included: financial statement audit experience; knowledge of SOX internal control requirements; knowledge of US GAAP; and experience with Microsoft Excel and Office suite of products. Must be willing to travel domestically up to 5% of time. Summary ANSYS, Inc. seeks Senior Application Engineer to work in Troy, MI. Responsibilities Partner with customers to solve their real-world engineering problems, deploy Ansys software in their design workflows, and grow Ansys’ business. Use expert-level engineering knowledge to provide technical pre-sales support, perform professional services, and help translate customer requirements into exciting new product features. Work within multi-disciplinary teams to create pervasive simulation solutions, advance industry knowledge, and grow the business impact. Specific job duties of this position include the following: Lead in coordinating and executing all technical activities throughout the sales opportunity lifecycle such as technical discovery, negotiate technical success criteria, product presentations, demonstrations and evaluations; Interact with customers to understand their product design needs and engineering design workflows; analyze how to address customers’ requirements using Ansys products and platform, and articulate Ansys’ value proposition; Assist in creating differentiating simulation solutions using the Ansys platform and products; deploy the solutions within customers’ design workflows; Develop competence as a subject matter expert and industry expert; Collaborate with the Ansys product development teams to translate customer requirements into exciting new product features; test new releases of Ansys products on industrial problems, and develop application best practices; Support Ansys field and digital marketing teams, and author conference presentations; and Contribute to consulting services, and conduct introductory and/or intermediate training classes. Minimum Qualifications Master’s degree or foreign equivalent in Mechanical, Chemical, Aerospace or Electrical Engineering or a related field of study, and three (3) years of experience in a related position. Alternate Acceptable Education and Work Experience Requirement: Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Mechanical, Chemical, Aerospace, Electrical Engineering or a related field of study, and five (5) years of experience in a related position. Must be willing to travel domestically up to 25% of time. jobTitle: Senior Application Engineer- Low Frequency Electromagnetics
jobDescription: Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Summary Join the Ansys Customer Excellence team to partner with our customers to engineer what's ahead, solve their real-world engineering problems, deploy Ansys software in their design workflows, and grow Ansys’ business. As a hands-on expert in Ansys products, you will use advanced-level engineering knowledge to provide technical professional services and help translate customer requirements into exciting new product features. You will be working within multi-disciplinary teams to create pervasive simulation solutions, advance your industry knowledge, and grow the business impact. Responsibilities Lead in mentoring and guidance to the electromagnetic modeling and simulation community Credibly and professionally on a strategy that delivers value to the customer that can be seen by reducing product cost, improving quality, and reducing time to market by adopting simulation throughout the design process Interact with customers to understand their product design needs and engineering design workflows; analyze how to address customers’ requirements using Ansys products and platform, articulate Ansys’ value proposition Understand customer’s business needs and expand application of ANSYS tools to new areas Increase the productivity of engineers by providing process development support, creating, and disseminating best practices Facilitate engagement with ANSYS development organization by sharing customer’s needs for feature enhancements and defect fixes Facilitate engagement with the broader ANSYS technical organization for advanced support and execution of service projects Help deploy ANSYS managed workflows (Custom GUIs, scripted I/O, etc.) Work as an integral member of the Sales and ACE teams to increase adoption of ANSYS tools Minimum Qualifications Required education and degree type: BS or MS or PhD in Electrical Engineering or related field Required minimum years of professional experience in an engineering software environment: BS+5, MS+3, or PhD+0 Two (2) years of experience using electromagnetic simulation with Ansys Maxwell or other commercial low frequency electromagnetic Finite Element simulation tools. Two (2) years of experience in modeling and simulation using electromagnetic finite element analysis for one or more of the following devices: electric machines, transformers, actuators, wireless charging, or magnetic sensors. Or two (2) years of experience in modeling and simulation using circuit or system simulation tools for power electronics applications. Fundamental understanding of physics phenomena and simulation methods related to power loss and efficiency for different electromagnetic device topologies. Hands-on experience using simulation to improve device or system performance using various optimization or design of experiments techniques. Summary / Role Purpose The Senior R&D Engineer is responsible for the development of software products and supporting systems. In this role, the Senior R&D Engineer will use advanced technical and problem-solving skills to help the team tackle complex issues, satisfy customer requirements, and accomplish development objectives.  The Senior Astrodynamics Engineer will join our innovative Orbit Determination Tool Kit (ODTK) product development team, applying one's domain knowledge, including a solid foundation in astodynamics, high-accuracy orbit determination and estimation, engineering, mathematics, and physics along with software development skills to produce software that solves complex problems. Activities include not only algorithm development, but the design, implementation, testing and documentation of software to implement those algorithms within an existing architecture to meet stakeholder requirements. A high level of autonomy and responsibility is required as well as interaction both internal and external to the company. This senior role also allows time for self-directed research in areas benefiting our target customer base. Publishing papers and participation in professional conferences is encouraged. This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship. Researches problems discovered by QA or product support and develops solutions Researches and understands the marketing requirements for a product, including target environment, performance criteria and competitive issues. Summary The CAD and Meshing development team at OnScale, an Ansys Company, is seeking a Senior R&D Engineer to manage automated handling of large, complex geometry models in preparation for simulation on a cloud-based system. Join a dynamic, entrepreneurial team of world-class scientists, engineers and developers focused on building the Future of Engineering. OnScale, an Ansys company, is bringing together the world’s most advanced and reliable engineering simulation software on a scalable, on-demand cloud computing platform. You have excellent C++ and python programming skill and a background in computer-aided design, engineering simulation or numerical methods. You likely have previous experience with well-known geometry modeling kernels like Parasolid, ACIS or OpenCascade and a strong interest in cloud technology. You will apply your experience working closely with a cross functional team of highly-motivated engineers and computer scientists. Ultimately, you will share responsibility for making massively parallel, cloud-based multiphysics simulation a reality for all engineers. Responsibilities Design and implement algorithms to automate geometry import, analysis and preparation for simulation Create and maintain well-structured and optimized code using the latest programming standards in C/C++ and Python. Develop the framework and efficient methods for handling large, complex models in a scalable cloud computing environment Participate in the planning and implementation of cloud-based geometry pre-processing workflows Be responsible for all aspects of the software development cycle including development, documentation, deployment and testing Minimum Qualifications BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics with 5 years’ experience, MS with 3 years’ experience, or PhD with 1 year experience Strong C/C++ and/or Python programming experience within commercial software Strong analytical skills. CAD processing, engineering simulation, computer graphics or related development experience. Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Summary The Senior Consulting Engineer is responsible for leveraging advanced engineering and tools knowledge in structural mechanics to help our customers to solve complex structural and electronics reliability problems using ANSYS software products. This is a proactive engagement to help streamline our customers’ design flow, improve product robustness and quality, as well as reduce their overall product cost by injecting simulation throughout the design process, thus enabling the customer to fully adopt simulation driven product development. This position will be located on-site at a customer’s office location . The Consulting Engineer will provide guidance and mentoring to the customer’s global engineering workforce to ensure their success in adopting ANSYS software tools. Responsibilities Lead in mentoring and guidance in electronics reliability and structural mechanics modeling to the simulation community. Credibly and professionally execute on a strategy that delivers value to the customer that can be seen by reducing product cost, improving quality, and reducing time to market by adopting simulation throughout the design process Interact with customers to understand their product design needs and engineering design workflows; analyze how to address customers’ requirements using Ansys products and platform, articulate Ansys’ value proposition Understand customer’s business needs and expand application of ANSYS tools to new areas Increase the productivity of engineers by providing process development support, creating, and disseminating best practices Facilitate engagement with ANSYS development organization by sharing customer’s needs for feature enhancements and defect fixes Facilitate engagement with the broader ANSYS technical organization for advanced support and execution of service projects Help deploy ANSYS managed workflows (Custom GUIs, scripted I/O, etc.) Work as an integral member of the Sales and ACE teams to increase adoption of ANSYS tools Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience Required education and degree type: BS or MS or PhD in Mechanical Engineering or related field Required minimum years of professional experience in an engineering software environment: BS+5, MS+3, or PhD+0 Demonstrated use of relevant Ansys software or knowledge of other commercial CAE, CAD, EDA, PLM software packages Experience performing FEA simulations (structural and thermal). A thorough and deep understanding in the fundamental concepts of Continuum Mechanics and Finite Element Methods is necessary. A good understanding of core principles in one or more of the following fields: Implicit and Explicit Dynamics Structural, Material and Contact non-linearities Thermo-mechanical Coupling and Physics Structural Durability (Fatigue and Failure) A specialty in one of the following applications: Electronics reliability: Possess the ability to understand and analyze major causes of failure in electronics (Thermal, Mechanical and Electrical stresses) Need to demonstrate an ability to pick up new concepts and technologies quickly. Self-learning will be critical to accomplish this skill. Logical problem-solving, strong interpersonal and communication skills, fluent in writing and speaking English Strong organizational and time management skills, possesses a sense of urgency Projects a professional image and demonstrates business acumen, driven to succeed Ability to travel up to 10% Preferred Qualifications And Skills Preferred education and years of professional experience in an engineering software environment: BS+8, MS+6, PhD+3 2 years of experience in application engineering, customer support, or consulting services type customer facing roles using engineering software Ability to interact effectively with senior business managers and C-level executives Experience with Finite Element simulation tools; ANSYS Mechanical, MAPDL and Ansys Sherlock experience preferred Experience in scripting languages such as Python is a plus CULTURE AND VALUES Our Values Are Crucial For Fostering a Culture Of Winning For Our Company Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world’s most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Whether you are a software developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better. Summary The Senior Software Development Engineer involves developing, implementing, and maintaining functionality related to the ANSYS MAPDL application and Mechanical product line. The immediate work will focus on advanced contact algorithms and contact related performance enhancements, and automatic settings/schemes for complicated nonlinear problems, not only structured but also in coupled physics analysis. Another major focus of this position is nonlinear transient analysis. Other areas of work for this position may include developing and enhancing implicit nonlinear solution, global procedure and high-performance computing capabilities. Experience in mechanical, civil, engineering mechanics or aerospace engineering with strong scientific programming and computational mechanics background is required. Responsibilities Participates in planning, architecture, and research in core mechanics features, including contact mechanics, nonlinear transient dynamics, and high-performance computational procedures Performs complex development activities that may require extensive analysis in areas including user experience, software design, research in contact modeling techniques and the related Multiphysics Employs best practices and helps to maintain them through technical reviews and mentoring Performs complex bug verification, release testing and beta support for assigned products. Research problems discovered by QA or product support and develop solutions Researches and understands the marketing requirements for the finite element and computational mechanics product, including target environment, per formance criteria and competitive issues. May work with strategic customers or proxies to assess needs and develop solutions Works independently with minimal supervision and may take on some planning and mentoring responsibilities May be responsible for managing interns or co-ops but typically does not have direct reports Minimum Qualifications BS in Mechanical or Aeronautical Engineering, Applied Mechanics or Mathematics, or related fields with 5 years’ experience, MS with 3 years’ experience, or PhD with 1 year experience Commercial experience of software packages with various usages of nonlinear finite element analysis and contact applications or other numerical analysis software. Strong scientific programming background in development & application of Finite Element Analysis techniques is required. Proficiency in FORTRAN, C/C++, Python, Microsoft Visual Studio environment, highly motivated with a strong work ethic. Preferred Qualifications Excellent technical knowledge and commercial experience with object-oriented design, scripting languages, data structures and algorithms. Linux experience is desirable. Ph.D. Degree with strong backgrounds in contact mechanics, transient dynamics, and finite element coding experience. Passion for crafting robust and efficient code. Experience delivering high-quality products in a large-scale commercial software development environment Understanding of customer requirements and tools used in this domain. Good communication and interpersonal skills Ability to work well with all levels of employees and management This position requires the ability to work in a geographically distributed development environment and requires excellent communication skills. Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world’s most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Whether you are a software developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better. Summary The Senior R&D Engineer contributes to the development of the Mechanical APDL product. In this role, the Senior R&D Engineer will collaborate with a team of expert professionals to tackle complex issues, satisfy customer requirements and accomplish development objectives. The successful candidate will be experienced in numerical linear algebra theory and programming and related parallel processing environments to design and develop robust, efficient algorithms. These algorithms will be used to improve the computing speed of mechanical FEA software. Ansys is the world leader in engineering simulation. Up to 80% of the cost of a product’s development is determined by the decisions you make early in the design process, and Ansys helps its customers reduce this cost with physical simulation tools to make better decisions quicker. Customers use Ansys simulation products to digitally explore design concepts and test critical design choices early in the product life cycle. Responsibilities Improve and enhance our direct and iterative linear equation solvers with the latest technologies to solve ill-conditioned equations from different element formulations. Work on the performance improvement and memory reduction under HPC environments when solving a very large linear set of equations, especially with a large number of constraint equations. Design, code, test, document, implement, and maintain software components and systems. Comfortable contributing to (and learning where necessary) anywhere within the full software stack (API design, database implementation, parallel programming, etc.) Performs moderately complex bug verification, release testing and beta support. Investigate problems discovered by QA or product support and develops solutions. Works under the general supervision of a development manager. Participates in planning, architecture, and research. Minimum Qualifications BS in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field with 5 years’ experience, MS with 3 years’ experience, or PhD with 1 year experience. Technical knowledge and experience with C/C++ and scripting languages. Experience with numerical linear algebra algorithms and programming Experience with parallel programming models (e.g., OpenMP, MPI) Strong understanding of data structures and data handling algorithms. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Preferred Qualifications Experience delivering high-quality products in a large-scale commercial software development environment. Commercial experience with various usages of linear algebra theory with finite element method or linear equation solvers packages or other numerical analysis software. Passion for crafting robust and efficient code. Understanding of customer requirements and tools used in this domain. Knowledge of or experience with CAE. Knowledge of or experience with Linux operating systems. Knowledge of or experience of agile development processes. Knowledge of or experience with DevOps processes and tools. Experience with either Microsoft or Amazon cloud environments. Ability to work independently and manage one's time. Proficiency in Fortran. Driven and willing to learn. Effective verbal and written communication skills. Strong interpersonal skills. Ability to learn quickly and to collaborate with others in a geographically distributed team. Summary The Senior R&D Engineer is responsible for the development of software products and supporting systems. As part of Office of CTO, in this role you will do software engineering in context of machine learning infrastructure and cloud services to design and implement scalable ML systems for ANSYS product portfolios. Responsibilities Research and prototype machine learning models and infrastructure to apply them for numerical simulations. Evolve frameworks into a cloud web service to be deployable in Azure, GCP or AWS ecosystem. Participates in planning, architecture and research. Employs best practices in software engineering, bring them to ML infrastruture and helps to maintain them through technical reviews and mentoring. Collaborate with product engineering teams to drive real-time model implementations and new feature creations. Design efficient/scalable processes for large scale data analyses, model development, framework development, model validation and model implementation. Works independently with minimal supervision and may take on some planning and mentoring responsibilities. Analyze and improve efficiency, scalability, quality of machine learning algorithm results and stability of various deployed systems Diagnose and fix code problems. Create unit regression and/or system-level tests to thoroughly validate new features or changes. Optimize code to improve computational efficiency and memory capacity. Required Minimum Years of Professional Experience: BS+5, MS+3, or PhD+1 2 years commercial development experience with software design, architecture, testing, service oriented architecture/micro-services and deploying in them cloud. 2 years of experience with Deep Learning, AI/ML Infrastructure, Machine Learning Frameworks Experience developing machine learning infrastructure in C++ or Python Expertise in C++ or Python with focus on deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit Learn or AutoML Preferred Qualifications Experience with web services, Azure stacks in C++ or C# or Python Experience with GPU programming (CUDA, OpenGL, OpenCL, DirectX). This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship. Summary ANSYS, Inc. seeks Senior Technical Support Engineer to work in Canonsburg, PA and various unanticipated locations. Use advanced-level engineering knowledge to provide technical post-sales support, find solutions to a wide variety of technical challenges, and channel customer feedback to improve Ansys products. The Simulation Process and Data Management (SPDM) Engineer is responsible for leveraging advanced-level engineering and product development knowledge to define, design, develop, deploy and deliver enterprise-level solutions that enable customers to utilize advanced simulation technologies more effectively throughout their product development and engineering processes, specifically on the following domains: engineering collaboration, configuration & change management, requirements, model-based engineering, Materials & Simulation Data Management. This position will work closely work with the customer, Ansys Enterprise Data Architects and Ansys deployment specialists to Understand the existing IT landscape of a customer Design, define, develop a solution for adapting the Ansys platform components to Customer requirements Execute on configuring the solution and integrating it with the overall IT landscape Participate in Pre-Sale activities like customer meetings and product demonstrations Create necessary collateral and demo environments Create SoWs, training material and other necessary documentation Responsibilities Analyze customers’ business and technical needs requirements, and the state of a customer’s current infrastructure, operations, and engineering workflows Consult our customers on process design and process optimization Derive the technical specifications in collaboration with other business process analysts, subject matter experts, peers and Ansys Product Management Produce clean and efficient code based on specifications Create elegant and useful solutions to solve complex business problems by working across various teams and understanding the needs of customers Coordinating and execute all technical activities (design, develop, deploy) throughout the sales opportunity such as customer meetings and product presentations, demonstrations and evaluations Utilize the components of the Ansys platform as the foundation for building complete solutions that transform customer product development processes to facilitate more engineering in the digital domain by leveraging simulation Articulate the Ansys value proposition, which may encompass its entire suite of products (mechanical, fluid, electrical, electronics, optical, systems, software...). Create training materials and assist in customers and partners training Create/assist in generating SoWs Create help manuals and deployment guides Participate in internal corporate initiatives to further enhance the solution suites, presales/sales enablement, and business growth Be a team player who can collaborate effectively with all key ANSYS and customer stakeholders including sales, product development, project management, implementation engineers, customer end-users and IT leadership Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree, Master’s or other advanced degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field 5 years of working experience in an agile team within commercial software development Experience in one of the following environments: Engineering Software – Ansys or Commercial CAE/CAD/EDA Enterprise Systems – MBSE/PLM/ALM/ERP Demonstratable skills in writing and presenting in fluent English Logical problem-solving mindset and the ability to communicate the situation and proposed solution Self-starter who possesses a sense of urgency, strong organizational and follow-up skills Communicate equally effectively at the executive level to discuss business requirements and value, as well as the engineering level to discuss technical requirements, capabilities, and benefits Ability to travel up to 20% PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Additional degree or course study in Engineering Mechanics, Mechanical, Aerospace and Civil Engineering or other technical discipline is a plus A minimum of 7 years of deep, broad, and demonstratable experience within IT infrastructures, such as the following: Working technical knowledge of C# and .Net programming languages Hands-on experience working in integrated development environments, including Microsoft Visual Studio. Knowledge with database management such as MS SQL Experience/Knowledge of Python Proficiency in front-end programming: JavaScript, React, jQuery, HTML5, Good understanding of web architecture, distributed systems and web APIs, such as REST APIs, SOAP and custom scripts Experience with Web Server technologies, such as IIS, nginx. Summary One of Ansys’ newest products, Discovery , is a unique real-time easy-to-use simulation tool that will make engineering simulation as pervasive as Excel. Some analysts have called it “one of the biggest breakthroughs in design and engineering technology in the last ten years.” Come and join the team that will transform how the products of tomorrow are engineered. The Live Technologies team seeks a software professional who will contribute to the development of our products and supporting systems. You will operate under general supervision but will have a reasonable amount of discretion to take independent action. The overall goal of your responsibilities is to define and develop the next-generation software, architecture, and tools for Ansys and its customers, with the clear intent of leap-frogging the competition. Ansys is the world leader in engineering simulation. Up to 80% of the cost of a product’s development is determined by the decisions you make early in the design process, and Ansys helps its customers reduce this cost with physical simulation tools to make better decisions quicker. Customers use Ansys simulation products to digitally explore design concepts and test critical design choices early in the product life cycle. Responsibilities Design, code, test, document, implement, and maintain software components and systems Comfortable contributing to (and learning where necessary) anywhere within the full software stack (API design, database implementation, business logic, etc.) Improve software development processes with tools and best practices Perform basic bug verification, release testing and support. The Strategic Account Manager builds long-term strategic relationships with strategically important global customers and partners. The Strategic Account Manager can be assigned to up to 3 Strategic Accounts, and responsible for achieving sales quota and assigned account objectives. The successful Strategic Account Manager represents the full portfolio of Ansys products and services to assigned customers, while leading the customer account planning cycle and ensuring assigned customers’ needs and expectations are met by the company. Key Duties And Responsibilities Facilitate future business with customer and identify and define solutions where ANSYS offerings can be applied by enabling that the right people in both organizations get together for activities such as management review meetings (MRMs), trainings, seminars, and info days to enhance new business opportunities . Meet or exceed new business sales plan across all BUs and the assigned accounts . Develop sales and technical partnerships to uncover, understand and document key technical challenges / pain points. Facilitate tool evaluations by identifying the appropriate Ansys Application Engineers, Product Specialists and, when required, R&D resources. Research, gather, analyze, maintain, and disseminate information about the accounts; develop exceptional knowledge of the customer and competitors and be well versed in the customer’s problems, KBIs, goals, needs, and issues . Understand and document the organizational chart and sales process. Document customer’s before and after required capabilities along with metrics that define success to facilitate the required tool evaluations . Coordinate with Ansys and Customer legal (as required) to facilitate required MNDAs . Oversee solution development and deliver (with help from account team and support function) compelling customer presentations in coordination with technical team . Define and create proposals/offers that represent maximum value to the customer and fair price for ANSYS; ensure that proposals address customer’s key issues, needs, and requirements, and align well their KBIs, Critical Success Factors, and KPIs . Facilitate contract negotiations and achieve a win for both the customer and Ansys. Provide accurate forecasts for new, renewal business, and services; maintain healthy pipeline to meet goals . Serve as a resource to Ansys channel partners within a designated territory by assisting with the sales process related to new and existing accounts, up to and including opportunity close. investments, and measure ROI results Orchestrate the execution of all elements of the partnership agreement Ensure that effective internal processes and legal frameworks are in place to manage and jobDescription: Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. The intern will get an opportunity to experience how software development is done to solve engineering problems in an intuitive and integrated Mechanical environment. Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Summary / Role Purpose Join the Ansys Customer Excellence team to partner with our customers to engineer what's ahead, solve their real-world engineering problems, deploy Ansys software in their design workflows, and grow Ansys’ business. As an AGI Engineering Intern, you will be trained in the use of AGI products and support our staff and customers in addressing some of the most challenging aerospace and defense problems. AGI continuously seeks highly motivated candidates who combine a passion for the aerospace and defense market with strong technical skills, proven leadership abilities and a demonstrated track record of working effectively with others. We provide our interns with an exceptional training program that will benefit participants throughout their technical careers. As an AGI Aerospace Engineering Intern, you will gain exposure to the fast-paced world of software-product development and directly contribute to multiple engineering teams. Although we look for employees to work in various offices, all report to their manager based out of our headquarters in Exton, PA. Currently, AGI is searching for experienced candidates with a desire to make a meaningful contribution to the aerospace and defense community and who have the technical and interpersonal skills required to do so in our fast-paced work environment. Key Duties And Responsibilities Developing product expertise in select facets of the STK family of products Providing technical assistance, best-practice education and problem-solving support for select applications of AGI products Presenting/documenting analysis results Programming user interfaces, automation scripts and integration code in support of customer applications Operate as part of a dynamic team of engineers, software developers and business professionals to assist customers in performing analyses, solving problems, and integrating and deploying custom solutions Contributing to product training programs Minimum Education/Certification Requirements And Experience Completion of at least two years of an accredited BS engineering or physics program, and a strong academic performance record (transcripts required) **prior to the start of the internship** Demonstrated ability in technical problem solving Strong oral and written communication skills are highly desirable Demonstrated leadership ability Working knowledge or experience with STK is desirable Scripting Experience in MATLAB, Python, or other scripting languages is desirable Capable of self-management and responsibly executing multiple tasks in accordance with priorities and deadlines Strong organizational and time management skills, possesses a sense of urgency Projects a professional image and demonstrates business acumen, driven to succeed U.S. Citizenship required CULTURE AND VALUES Our Values Are Crucial For Fostering a Culture Of Winning For Our Company Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Summary ANSYS empowers the world's most innovative companies to design and deliver transformational products by offering the best and broadest engineering simulation software to solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Thus, through our enriching intern program, we help develop the next-generation of engineers and technologists. Each semester builds upon the foundational learning that prepares you for more advanced problem solutions. This is a 40-hour per week paid position starting May 2023 and concluding August 2023. Responsibilities Ansys is looking for a mechanical, materials, electrical, or chemical engineering intern to help support Reliability Engineering Services (RES) in the Beltsville office and test/lab facility. Multiple backgrounds and skillsets are desired to assist consulting engineers in failure analysis and testing, with a focus on materials characterization. The intern will analyze the microstructure of additive printed metals utilizing tools such as diamond band saws, semi-automated polishing equipment, vibratory polisher, ion polisher, and electron backscatter diffraction (EBSD) using scanning electron microscopy (SEM). Recipes for proper polishing will be researched and trialed to realize robust and repeatable identification of crystal structure and orientation, as well allow for porosity analysis. This data is critical for proper modeling of the additive process and materials by Ansys simulation engineers. The position also involves setup and characterization of plastics for tensile creep/relaxation properties. Minimum Requirements Candidate must be pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical, Materials, Electrical, or Chemical Engineering, with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. Must be currently enrolled in a full-time degree program. An affinity for a hands-on approach to engineering, interacting with a variety of engineering disciplines Good attention to detail, with a curiosity in the physical phenomena driving various processes are essential Sharp problem-solving skills. Team player, responsible, and motivated. Preferred Qualifications Experience with mechanical and analytical lab equipment, including EBSD CULTURE AND VALUES Our Values Are Crucial For Fostering a Culture Of Winning For Our Company Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. Join the Ansys Student Internship Program to apply your education to solve real world engineering problems, advance career skills and experience work at Ansys. The student intern will be part of the Ansys Mechanical team and will work together with the team to develop advanced engineering features in Mechanical flagship product. The intern will get an opportunity to experience how software development is done to solve engineering problems in an intuitive and integrated Mechanical environment and will contribute to advance engineering features like fracture mechanics, linear dynamics, coupled field analysis, etc. The intern will also get to experience of how software design principles apply in an engineering discipline to simulate physics for next generation products. Investigate defects in production code. Develop unit tests for the developed features. Analyze results and improve the usability of the software.
